location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.144 of 1855 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of Kemball’s earlier letter on proceedings at Bahrain. Anderson emphasises that Kemball should not attempt any military actions that, in his opinion, could not be carried out successfully. Anderson requests that Kemball advise him if his resources in the Gulf are deemed insufficient. In the margin of the letter, there is a brief outline of these resources in the Gulf: ‘The Clive, 14 guns sloop, Falkland, 12 guns sloop, Tigris, 5 guns sloop, Constance, 3 guns sloop’.
